Description: Steatite (?) scaraboid engraved with imitation Egyptian hieroglyphs and other incised markings; above are two standing figures, while below are several stylised motifs: a wheel, a horned animal, standing figure and various symbols.
Curator's comments: The BM gem catalogue gives Mari as the provenance, but the excavation notes say Kalavasos. Porada (in Johnson 1980, p. 71) observes that neither the shape nor the design corresponds to any dated parallels in Egypt or anywhere else. The linear (incised and not moulded) nature of the decoration suggests a Cypro-Geometric date.
Bibliographic references: Gem / Catalogue of Engraved Gems & Cameos, Greek, Etruscan & Roman in the British Museum (294)
